instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879B: What is 820-2879B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message:
hi, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second i turn it on
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6v
l7400 dropped from 1.1v to 0.9v
I have pp3v42, what next should I check ? thankss

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message:
Run ASD and see if any error pops up.
Or install HWMonitor and check temperatures.
You can also try another BIOS file; no ME issue possible, as it is not iCore machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message: im sorry, but the board doesnt turn on, forget to give the details

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message:
Please post accurate information.
You said in the first post "fan spin high after a few second i turn it on"...

In fact, look like your board bots.
"l7400 dropped from 1.1v to 0.9v"
So use USB mouse, or better USB OSX pendrive with Link LED, to confirm (or not) USB activity.
Also fan goes high, if trackpad board, or cable is bad!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message:
ohh yeah sorry, I meant fan spin high a few second after I connect the magsafe
I got light on the mouse!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message:
USB mouse can trick you, always better to check the other mentioned way.
Check at least if USB mouse gets steady light when you disconnect/reconnect it, on both ports.

Do you get external video?
Nothing on internal LCD, missing image and backlight too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message:
so the board suddenly start normally, tested all function, its normal.
is there any componen intermittently working ? is there anything I should check?

History : the customer came 1 week ago with his own charging port and battery, requesting us to install it for him, and then a few days later his macbook got trouble like I mentioned above

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
threads.message:
I doubt you can diagnose a good working machine...

Run ASD, just in case; probably no errors, if machine works good now.
You can also test it with different chargers.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin high after a few second
